intro: Monnina emarginata, commonly known as prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It has small, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive notched or serrated edge. Monnina emarginata is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
